group_1.textLeft: First off, there's several things I'd like to confirm.
Is this really due to all three of our magics@interacting?

group_1.textRight: I'd say so. Nemu Hiiragi's theory is, by and large,@correct.
Each of your magics joined together with the@others...
To produce complicated side effects.@...That ought to be what's going on.

group_1.textLeft: We're almost entirely done with filming; all that's@left is a few insert shots.
So why are the side effects continuing?

group_1.textRight: You just answered your own question.
You're "almost" doneâ€” but not entirely, yes?
Until the director, Seira Mihono, acknowledges that@the script is complete...
The current side effects are likely to remain active.

group_1.textLeft: So until Mihono thinks that there's nothing left@to film...
The reconstructed personae will remain, the@East-West conflict will continue to smolder...
...and incidents roughly mimicking the script will@keep happening?

group_1.textRight: Indeed.

group_1.textLeft: Say I rewrite the script to have a happy ending.
Will my "kotodama" activate, and avert the@worst-case scenario?

group_1.textRight: That would be a massive gamble.

group_1.textLeft: Really?

group_1.textRight: Now that your magic has activated, trying to forcibly@revise it...
Will result in massive strain on your own psyche.

group_1.textLeft: (Back when I exhausted myself badly enough to put@strain on my own mind...)
(That was because I tried to force my already-active@magic to change course...!)
(...I suppose it's only natural that manipulating@people's hearts would damage my own in turn...)

group_1.textRight: That may be, but I'd strongly caution you against@trying to control it by force.
In my case, I was able to manifest whatever story@I wanted...
But I had to pay an enormous price in return.
...You can see the result just by looking at me.
Has this brought anything particular to mind?

group_1.textLeft: Yes. ...If I took that much damage from such a small@script revision...
...then it'll be impossible to rewrite the entire@ending.
I'd be an empty shell before I could finish writing.

group_1.textRight: In that case, it seems likely that your magic...
...will run its course as the script dictates.
Until the script's reenactment is either completed,@or rendered void.

group_1.textLeft: I see. I suppose we'll have to find some other@way...[chara:304001:lipSynch_0][wait:1.2][chara:304001:lipSynch_1][chara:304001:eyeClose_0]huh?
...Did you just say "rendered void"?

group_1.textRight: Yes.
Your magic activated for the sake of the movie's@production, right?
If the movie's script itself is disposed of, it stands to@reason that the effects will wear off.

group_1.textLeft: So instead of straining my mind to rewrite it, I can@just tear the whole thing up?
And the magic will wear off with something that@simple?

group_1.textRight: Undoubtedly. However, I wouldn't recommend it.

group_1.textLeft: Why?

group_1.textRight: If you try to destroy the script of your own volition...
You'll experience identical or even worse strain to@that of an attempted rewrite.
After all, you'd be trying to force your already-active@magic to change course either way.

group_1.textLeft: Is that really true?

group_1.textRight: Yes. There was once a Magical Girl who invited a@tragedy by trying to do that exact thing.
You're quite familiar with her already.

group_1.textLeft: ...Who do you mean?

group_1.textRight: Ruri.
